title: Collecting eDNA from marine water samples in the field
title_html: Collecting eDNA from marine water samples in the field

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description: Collect water in an appropriate sterile, DNA free container.

source.body: For marine samples collected during scuba diving, we use a small hand-pump and a punch-balloon.

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description:
Filter
-
with the 250 ml filters (0.8 micron, cellulose nitrate) from Nalgene.

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description: Connect filter unit to vacuum pump, filter by vacuum.

source.body: I use a small vacuum-pump from ebay, powered with a 12V power pack. (DC12V Mini Vacuum Pump Negative Pressure Suction Pump)

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description: Using the vacuum, make sure the filter is dry, as to much transfer of liquid influences preservation and downstream DNA isolation.

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description: Cut filter from filter unit, it is glued in place. No problem to cut off outer 0.5 cm of filter. Use sterile scalpel + scalpel holder. Fold filter twice using scalpel+tweezers.

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description:
Insert filter in 2 ml screwcap tube prefilled with
.

source.body: It is possible to use other tubes, but not when using 3d-fuge, as these do not fit and will snap open during centrifugation.

source.title: Collection of eDNA from the water on a filter membrane

source.description:
Shake tube with filter, to fully soak in the preservation solution. Repeat after
-
to re-soak. Filter ready for storage.

The DNA is now collected on the filter. Either directly continue with the DNA isolation protocol of choice, or store the preserved the DNA on the filter, depending on preservation method used.
Qiagen DNeasy kit, short term (<48h) preservation:
Store filter in
from the DNeasy kit, shake well, store at
or below.
Zymo DNA/RNA shield, short+longterm preservation:
Store filter in
, shake well, store at
or below.
Longmire’s solution: longterm preservation:
Store filter in
-
, shake well, store at RT or below

source.body: Other alternative preservation methods: ethanol, freezing, DMSO, DESS, dehydration, combinations, etc.

source.body:
• Pipetting is a bit of hassle with the filter in the tube, best to remove most buffer, spin shortly, remove rest. Also you will need to load the DNA filter tube twice to process all liquid.
  • Elute in either recommended or use lower elution volume (down to ) if more concentrated DNA is required.

source.body:
• Pipetting is a bit of hassle with the filter in the tube, best to remove most buffer, spin shortly, remove rest.
  • Elute in either recommended volume ( ) or use higher elution volume if more dilute DNA is required.

source.description:
Before doing DNA extraction incubate for
with protK at
.

source.body: Use classic phenol/chlorophorm extraction, that works also very well. I did this with the samples I preserved in Longmire solution, can also be done with samples in DNA/RNA shield.

source.description: Either use a 15ml tube, or the following idea will also work: cut the filter from the 500 ml units in 4 equal pieces and process these separately. Isolate DNA from 2 quarters, store the other 2 in Longmire for later if something goes wrong with the isolation.

source.body: With the larger filter units (500ml) you also get larger filters, which do not fit in a 2ml tube.

source.title: Isolation of eDNA from Longmire preserved filter-membranes

source.description: If filters in 2ml tubes and volume <1ml, extraction can be done in the 2ml tubes, much easier. If filter preserved in more than 1 ml liquid, transfer to 15ml falcon tubes, or use the 15ml tubes with the filters.

source.body: Optional when using 15ml tubes: Add several sterile, DNA free, 4mm glass-beads.

materials.name: Thermo Scientific™ Nalgene™ Rapid-Flow™ Sterile Disposable Filter Units with CN Membrane

description:
This protocol describes the process of collecting eDNA from marine water samples in the field and four different approaches for preservation of filters with eDNA as well as eDNA extraction:
  1. Qiagen DNeasy kit
  2. Zymo DNA/RNA shield
  3. Longmire’s solution
  4. Alternative methods
